content: Madrigal's Magic Key to Spanish
Complete Grading Rubric & Reward Point System
1. Grading Philosophy
This system follows the principle: "Process Earns, Mastery Multiplies."
Students earn steady base points for completing daily work consistently. Bonus multipliers and thematic mastery badges reward demonstrated understanding and long-term retention.

For Spanish, speaking ability is weighted equally with written work, reflecting the reality that language is primarily a spoken skill. The system balances vocabulary acquisition, grammar patterns, and oral fluency.
2. Course Structure

Madrigal's Magic Key to Spanish contains 45 lessons (Lecciones) organized into 8 units with cumulative assessments. The course uses Madrigal's 5 built-in "Test Your Progress" sections plus 3 additional checkpoints.

sections.heading: 2.1 Unit Breakdown
content: 3. Per-Lesson Components
Each of the 45 lessons includes the following graded components:
4. Grade Weight Distribution
The course grade is calculated from five categories, with speaking elevated to equal status with written work.
tables: Unit Test 2 — Madrigal's "Test Your Progress" p.82
Unit Test 3 — Madrigal's "Test Your Progress" p.153
Unit Test 5 — Madrigal's "Test Your Progress" p.256
Unit Test 6 — Madrigal's "Test Your Progress" p.362
Unit Test 7 — Madrigal's "Test Your Progress" p.390

sections.heading: 4.2 Detailed Breakdown
content: Daily Practice — Written (20%)
Book Exercises: 12% of total grade (accuracy-based)
Supplementary Worksheet: 8% of total grade (accuracy-based)
Flashcard System (20%)
Flashcard Creation (all 3 types): 8% of total grade
Flashcard Mastery (Box 7): 12% of total grade
Speaking Component (20%)
Daily Read-Aloud: 5% of total grade (completion + self-check)
Lesson Conversation Performance: 10% of total grade (rubric-based)
Weekly Speaking Assessment: 5% of total grade (cumulative rubric)
Unit Tests (20%)
Each of the 8 unit tests: 2.5% of total grade
Cumulative Exams (20%)
Midterm Exam: 8% of total grade
Final Exam: 12% of total grade (includes oral component)
5. Speaking Assessment System
Speaking is assessed through three complementary methods to develop comprehensive oral fluency.

sections.heading: 5.1 Daily Read-Aloud
content: For each lesson, the student:
Records themselves reading the lesson vocabulary and example sentences
Compares their recording to reference audio (native speaker or quality resource)
Self-assesses and notes areas for improvement
Parent spot-checks periodically (at least 2× per week)
Grading: Completion-based. Full points for completing recording + self-check. Parent spot-check can adjust if effort is lacking.

sections.heading: 5.2 Lesson Conversation Performance
content: Each lesson's "Conversation using..." section is performed orally with a partner (parent, sibling, or recorded dialogue). Scored using the Speaking Rubric below.

sections.heading: 5.3 Weekly Speaking Assessment
content: At the end of each week, a cumulative conversation assessment combines material from all lessons covered that week. This is a more formal evaluation demonstrating integrated speaking ability.

sections.heading: 5.4 Speaking Rubric (4-Point Scale)
content: Each speaking performance is scored across four categories. Maximum score = 16 points.
Score Calculation: (Total Points / 16) × Points Available = Earned Points
6. Reward Point Values
Points are earned for each completed component. These points feed directly into the reward system.
tables: Smooth, natural pace, no unnatural pauses

sections.heading: 6.3 Flashcard Mastery Points
content: Each flashcard that reaches Leitner Box 7 earns a one-time graduation bonus, permanently locked once achieved.
Note: Vocabulary cards tested in both directions (Spanish→English and English→Spanish) count as separate cards for mastery purposes.

sections.heading: 6.4 Assessment Point Values
content: 7. Bonuses & Multipliers

sections.heading: 7.1 Streak Bonuses
content: Completing lessons on consecutive days earns streak multipliers applied to daily practice points.
Note: Missing a day resets the streak to Day 1. Weekends and scheduled breaks do not break streaks.

sections.heading: 7.2 Test Improvement Bonus
content: Scoring higher than your previous unit test earns an improvement bonus.

sections.heading: 7.3 Speaking Streak Bonus
content: Consecutive perfect or excellent weekly speaking assessments earn additional bonuses.

sections.heading: 7.4 Milestone Bonuses
content: 8. Thematic Mastery Badges
Each lesson is tagged by linguistic theme. Completing all lessons in a theme AND graduating all associated flashcards to Box 7 earns a Mastery Badge with significant bonus points.
tables: Pass Final Exam (70%+ on both written & oral)
Perfect score on Final Oral Exam

sections.heading: 8.1 Badge Categories
tables: All cognate pattern lessons + pattern cards to Box 7
All past tense lessons + conjugation cards to Box 7
All present tense lessons + conjugation cards to Box 7
All future tense lessons + conjugation cards to Box 7
All pronoun lessons + cards to Box 7
All irregular/stem-changing lessons + cards to Box 7
Lessons 41-42 + all subjunctive cards to Box 7
All vocabulary cards (both directions) to Box 7

sections.heading: 8.2 Badge Requirements
content: To earn a Mastery Badge (except Conversation Master), a student must:
Complete all lessons tagged with that theme (lecture + exercises + worksheet)
Create all flashcards for those lessons
Graduate ALL associated flashcards to Leitner Box 7
Score 80%+ average on unit tests covering those lessons
9. Lesson-to-Theme Mapping
Below is the complete mapping of all 45 lessons to their thematic tags. Lessons may have multiple tags.

sections.heading: 9.1 Cognates (COG)
content: Patterns: -al, -ble, -ic, -ent, -ant, -ist, -ous, -ion, -ty, -ry, -em, -in, -ine, -ive, -ce, -cy, -cle, -y, -ct, -ure, -ute, -ing

sections.heading: 9.2 Past Tense (PAST)
content: Includes: Preterite singular/plural, irregular pasts (tuve, estuve, hice, vine), present perfect with haber, imperfect (I used to)

sections.heading: 9.3 Present Tense (PRES)
content: Includes: Present tense singular/plural for -ar/-er/-ir verbs, stem-changing verbs, gustar construction

sections.heading: 9.4 Future Tense (FUT)
content: Lessons: 11, 12, 13
Includes: Future expressions with -ar/-er/-ir verbs

sections.heading: 9.5 Pronouns (PRO)
content: Includes: Direct objects (him, her, you), indirect objects (to him, to her), reflexives (me, myself, se, yourself), possessives, combining pronouns

sections.heading: 9.6 Irregular Verbs (IRR)
content: Includes: Stem-changing verbs (I, II, III), -cer verbs, -uir verbs, irregular past participles, verbs with spelling changes

sections.heading: 9.7 Subjunctive (SUBJ)
content: Lessons: 41, 42
Includes: Expressing hope, fear, doubt, desire in present and past subjunctive

sections.heading: 9.8 Conversation & Expressions (CONV)
content: Includes: Greetings (¿Cómo está?), commands, common expressions, practical dialogues

sections.heading: 9.9 Vocabulary Themes (VOC)
content: Includes: Days of the week, months of the year, numbers, menu vocabulary, diminutives

sections.heading: 9.10 Grammar & Structure (GRAM)
content: Includes: Question formation, noun plurals, adjectives, adverbs, passive voice, double negatives, stresses and accents
10. Maximum Point Totals
The following summarizes the maximum possible points a student can earn in Madrigal's Spanish.

sections.heading: 10.2 Weekly Speaking Assessments
content: Assuming ~9 weeks to complete the course:

sections.heading: 10.4 Flashcard Mastery (estimated)
content: Assuming ~20 vocabulary cards, ~2 pattern cards, and ~4 conjugation cards per lesson:

sections.heading: 10.6 Grand Total
content: Note: Actual totals will vary based on streak length, speaking performance patterns, and exact flashcard counts per lesson.
11. Grade Scale
The following letter grade scale applies to the weighted course average (not reward points):
12. Implementation Notes

sections.heading: 12.1 Grading Daily Work
content: Book Exercises and Worksheets are graded on accuracy (% correct × base points)
Perfect scores (100%) earn the accuracy bonus automatically
Lecture attendance is binary: present and engaged = full points, absent = 0

sections.heading: 12.2 Flashcard System
content: Students must create Vocabulary, Pattern, AND Conjugation cards for applicable lessons
Vocabulary cards must be practiced in BOTH directions (Spanish→English and English→Spanish)
Box 7 graduation is tracked per-card; bonus awarded once per card lifetime
Cards that fall back from Box 7 do not lose their graduation bonus

sections.heading: 12.3 Speaking Assessment
content: Daily Read-Aloud recordings should be saved for reference and progress tracking
Conversation Performances can be done with parent, sibling, or as recorded dialogues
Weekly Speaking Assessments should cumulate that week's vocabulary and structures
Parent spot-checks of Daily Read-Aloud recommended at least 2× per week

sections.heading: 12.4 Test Retakes
content: Unit tests may be retaken once after additional review (higher score kept)
Retake scores are capped at 90% to incentivize first-attempt preparation
Midterm and Final exams cannot be retaken

sections.heading: 12.5 Reference Audio Sources
content: Recommended sources for pronunciation reference:
SpanishDict.com (free audio for individual words)
Forvo.com (native speaker recordings)
Google Translate audio (acceptable for sentences)
YouTube native speaker content for conversational practice
— End of Document —
